HIV if you didn't see this week researchers in London announced that their patient has experienced sustained remission from HIV after 18 months off of
Medication now despite some headlines that you've seen it is still too early to say the patient was cured though. Scientists are optimistic
So how did they do it? Well along with HIV the patient had Hodgkin's lymphoma that was not responding to chemotherapy
So they required a bone-marrow transplant
But instead of just taking any match for a bone marrow donation
researchers led by Ravindra Gupta an infectious diseases physician at the University of Cambridge
They found a donor that had two copies of a mutation on the ccr5 gene that gives people resistance to HIV infection
Why does it do that? Dr
De Franco you may ask well ccr5 codes a receptor on the surface of white blood cells
Which is incredibly important because that is what HIV binds to in order to enter an attack the cell lots with this mutation the receptor
Does not function properly an HIV can't latch to the cell
So when a patient gets a bone-marrow transplant
It destroys their blood cells and replace them with stem cells from the donor and because it's all coming together
This donor had HIV resistant cells. Now that patient has HIV resistant cells reportedly 16 months after the transplant the patients
Stop taking their antiretroviral drugs
Which are the usual treatment for HIV and in the latest follow-up about 18 months after they stopped the drugs
There was no trace of HIV in their system
And once again, this is not enough time for it to be considered cured
But they are optimistic that the current results will continue also of no
This is not the first time that someone has been reportedly cured of HIV

But now Trudeau is involved in a corruption scandal that alleges his office attempted to settle a criminal case against SNC Laval on a multinational
Engineering and construction firm based in Canada and the criminal case against SNC claims that the company paid millions of dollars in bribes to officials
In Libya in order to secure lucrative contracts and this reportedly including millions and bribes paid to the regime of Libyan dictator Moammar Ghadafi

it boasts more than 50,000 employees worldwide and what we're talking about is 10.1 billion in revenue in 2018 like

9 people were charged in that case and one Quebec police investigator called it the biggest case of corruption fraud in Canadian history. The case
About today actually started back in February of 2015 when Canadian authorities charged SNC with paying forty seven point seven million
Canadian dollars in bribes to officials in Libya and that was along with defrauding the Libyan government of one hundred twenty nine point eight million
Canadian dollars and if SNC is convicted
It could be banned from federal government contracts for a decade

Jody Wilson Raybould was given oversight of the case regarding Libya Wilson Raybould also identifies as indigenous and her appointment was applauded by many in
Canada who took it as a sign of Trudeau's commitment to indigenous people and women. But then in January 2019 Trudeau
Reassigned Wilson rebelled to the Veteran Affairs Department, which is a major demotion then on February 7th
The Globe and Mail publishes an investigative report that says Trudeau and his aides had actually attempted to direct Wilson rables handling of the
